cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
In which film did Johnny Depp play a policeman called Ichabod Crane?
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
To answer the question, I need to identify the film in which Johnny Depp portrays a character named Ichabod Crane. Ichabod Crane is a well-known character from Washington Irving's "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow." Johnny Depp played this character in the film adaptation directed by Tim Burton. The film is known for its dark and gothic style, which is characteristic of Burton's work. 

Answer: Sleepy Hollow

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
In which film did Johnny Depp play a policeman called Ichabod Crane?
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['BULLET::::- Johnny Depp as Ichabod Crane: Crane is a quirky, yet sympathetic constable infatuated with integrating modern science into police procedures, but is squeamish at the sight of blood and bugs. Depp is humorous in his portrayal of the character.\n', 'While Johnny Depp was Burton\'s first choice for the role of Ichabod Crane, Paramount required him to consider Brad Pitt, Liam Neeson and Daniel Day-Lewis. Depp was cast in July 1998 for his third collaboration with Burton. The actor wanted Ichabod to parallel Irving\'s description of the character in the short story. This included a long prosthetic snipe nose, huge ears, and elongated fingers. Paramount turned down his suggestions, and after Depp read Tom Stoppard\'s rewrite of the script, he was inspired to take the character even further. "I always thought of Ichabod as a very delicate, fragile person who was maybe a little too in touch with his feminine side, like a frightened little girl," Depp explained. He did not wish to portray the character as a typical action star would have, and instead took inspiration by Angela Lansbury\'s performance in "Death on the Nile". "It\'s good," Burton reasoned, "because I\'m not the greatest action director in the world, and he\'s not the greatest action star." Depp modeled Ichabod\'s detective personality from Basil Rathbone in the 1939 "Sherlock Holmes" film series. He also studied Roddy McDowall\'s acting for additional influence. Burton added that "the idea was to try to find an elegance in action of the kind that Christopher Lee or Peter Cushing or Vincent Price had." Christina Ricci, who worked with producer Scott Rudin on "The Addams Family", was cast as Katrina Van Tassel. "Sleepy Hollow" also reunited Burton with Jeffrey Jones (from "Beetlejuice" and "Ed Wood") as Reverend Steenwyck, Christopher Walken (Max Shreck in "Batman Returns") as the Hessian Horseman, Martin Landau ("Ed Wood") in a cameo role, and Hammer veteran Michael Gough (Alfred in Burton\'s "Batman" films), whom Burton tempted out of retirement. The Hammer influence was further confirmed by the casting of Christopher Lee in a small role as the Burgomaster who sends Crane to Sleepy Hollow.\n', 'BULLET::::- Constable Ichabod Crane serves as the protagonist in the 1999 film adaptation of "Sleepy Hollow", directed by Tim Burton and starring Johnny Depp. In this interpretation, he is a New York City policeman with an interest in Forensic science sent to Sleepy Hollow to investigate a series of grisly murders to prove the merits of his style of the investigation after he argues against the police\'s current methods. As in the original story, his horse is named Gunpowder. Ichabod\'s most notable traits in the movie include an ahead-of-his-time liking for post-mortem examinations, deduction, and scientific methods, as well as his being very quirky, skittish, and being disturbed by death and blood, despite his occupation. His backstory is also explored: when he was seven his mother, an "innocent child of Nature" was "murdered to save her soul" by his father, "a Bible black tyrant behind a mask of righteousness" which led to a loss of faith for him. It is Ichabod who finally releases the Hessian Headless Horseman (Christopher Walken) from the control of Lady van Tassel (Miranda Richardson), whom the Horseman takes to Hell with him. Katrina Van Tassel (Christina Ricci) is seen at the end of the movie going back to New York with Ichabod, along with a boy who helped him in the investigation. Brom Bones (Casper Van Dien), who at one point does disguise himself as the Horseman and throws a pumpkin at Ichabod, is killed by the real Horseman halfway in the film.\n', 'Depp\'s next venture with Burton was the period film "Sleepy Hollow" (1999), in which he played Ichabod Crane opposite Christina Ricci and Christopher Walken. For his performance, Depp took inspiration from Angela Lansbury, Roddy McDowall and Basil Rathbone. He stated that he "always thought of Ichabod as a very delicate, fragile person who was maybe a little too in touch with his feminine side, like a frightened little girl."\n', 'BULLET::::- Ichabod Crane is also featured in the 2013 episodic video game, "The Wolf Among Us", developed and produced by Telltale Games. In the game, Crane (voiced by Roger L. Jackson) is the deputy mayor of Fabletown, a secret community of magical, fairytale beings who were exiled from their Homelands centuries ago and forced to live in the world of mundane humans. In episodes 2 through three, Crane was revealed to have been soliciting prostitutes and using a magic spell to make them look like his assistant Snow White; Sheriff Bigby Wolf and Snow arrest Crane for this and embezzling Fabletown\'s money to pay for them, but Crane is then kidnapped by the minions of the Crooked Man, the crime lord Crane owes money to.\n']

Task Description:
Please extract content that may be unfamiliar to the model from these passages, 
which can provide the model with relevant background and unknown knowledge and concepts, 
helping it better understand the question. and analyze the role of these contents.

The passages provided contain several key pieces of information that may be unfamiliar or provide additional context for understanding the question regarding Johnny Depp's role as Ichabod Crane in the film "Sleepy Hollow." Here’s a breakdown of the relevant content and its significance:

1. **Film Title and Release Year**:
   - The film in which Johnny Depp plays Ichabod Crane is titled "Sleepy Hollow," and it was released in 1999. This is crucial information as it directly answers the question.

2. **Director**:
   - The film was directed by Tim Burton. Understanding the director's style and previous works can provide insight into the film's aesthetic and thematic choices, which may influence how Depp's character is portrayed.

3. **Character Background**:
   - Ichabod Crane is described as a quirky and sympathetic constable who integrates modern science into police procedures. This characterization is significant because it sets him apart from traditional portrayals of law enforcement in period pieces, emphasizing a more intellectual and sensitive approach to his role.
   - The passages mention that Ichabod is squeamish at the sight of blood and bugs, which adds depth to his character and contrasts with typical action hero traits. This characterization may influence audience expectations and interpretations of his actions throughout the film.

4. **Plot Context**:
   - Ichabod Crane is sent to Sleepy Hollow to investigate a series of grisly murders. This plot point is essential for understanding the narrative arc of the film and Ichabod's motivations. His interest in forensic science and post-mortem examinations highlights a progressive approach to crime-solving during the film's historical setting.

5. **Character Development**:
   - The passages provide insight into Ichabod's backstory, including the traumatic event of his mother's murder by his father. This background is crucial for understanding his psychological state and motivations, which may inform his actions and decisions throughout the film.

6. **Character Relationships**:
   - The mention of other characters, such as Katrina Van Tassel (played by Christina Ricci) and the Hessian Horseman (played by Christopher Walken), provides context for Ichabod's interactions and the dynamics within the story. Understanding these relationships can enhance comprehension of the film's themes and character development.

7. **Influences on Depp's Portrayal**:
   - Depp's inspiration for his portrayal of Ichabod Crane from various actors and performances (e.g., Angela Lansbury, Roddy McDowall, Basil Rathbone) suggests a layered approach to character development. This information can help viewers appreciate the nuances of his performance and the artistic choices made in bringing the character to life.

8. **Cinematic Style**:
   - The passages hint at Burton's unique style, which often blends gothic elements with dark humor. This context can help viewers understand the tone of "Sleepy Hollow" and how Depp's performance fits within that framework.

In summary, the extracted content provides a comprehensive background on the film "Sleepy Hollow," the character of Ichabod Crane, and Johnny Depp's portrayal. This information is essential for answering the question accurately and understanding the film's narrative and thematic complexities. It highlights the importance of character development, plot context, and directorial influence in shaping the audience's experience.

Answer:

**Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:**

To answer the question about the film in which Johnny Depp plays a policeman named Ichabod Crane, I need to identify the specific movie and provide context about the character and the film's background.

1. **Identifying the Film**: 
   - The character Ichabod Crane is famously associated with Washington Irving's "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow." Johnny Depp portrayed this character in the film adaptation titled "Sleepy Hollow," which was released in 1999.

2. **Director's Influence**: 
   - The film was directed by Tim Burton, known for his distinctive gothic and whimsical style. Understanding Burton's directorial approach is important as it shapes the film's aesthetic and thematic elements, which influence how Depp's character is portrayed.

3. **Character Traits**: 
   - Ichabod Crane is depicted as a quirky and sympathetic constable who is ahead of his time, integrating modern forensic science into his investigative methods. This portrayal contrasts with traditional depictions of law enforcement in period films, emphasizing a more intellectual and sensitive approach.

4. **Character's Psychological Depth**: 
   - The character's squeamishness at the sight of blood and bugs adds complexity to his persona, making him relatable and distinct from typical action heroes. This trait may affect audience expectations regarding his reactions and decisions throughout the film.

5. **Plot Overview**: 
   - Ichabod Crane is sent to the village of Sleepy Hollow to investigate a series of gruesome murders. His role as a forensic investigator highlights a progressive approach to crime-solving, which is significant given the film's historical context.

6. **Backstory and Motivation**: 
   - Ichabod's traumatic backstory, including the murder of his mother by his father, provides insight into his psychological state and motivations. This background is crucial for understanding his character's development and actions throughout the narrative.

7. **Character Relationships**: 
   - The film features key relationships, such as Ichabod's interactions with Katrina Van Tassel (played by Christina Ricci) and the Hessian Horseman (played by Christopher Walken). These relationships are vital for understanding the film's dynamics and themes.

8. **Artistic Influences on Depp's Performance**: 
   - Depp drew inspiration from various actors for his portrayal of Ichabod Crane, which indicates a thoughtful and layered approach to character development. This context helps viewers appreciate the nuances of his performance.

9. **Cinematic Style and Themes**: 
   - The film's blend of gothic elements and dark humor, characteristic of Burton's style, contributes to the overall tone and atmosphere of "Sleepy Hollow." This understanding enhances the viewer's experience and comprehension of the film's themes.

In summary, the film "Sleepy Hollow," directed by Tim Burton, features Johnny Depp as Ichabod Crane, a character who embodies a unique blend of intellectual curiosity and psychological complexity. The film's narrative, character relationships, and Burton's stylistic choices all contribute to a rich viewing experience.

**Answer**: Sleepy Hollow

Task Description:

Engage in a dialogue where you imagine discussing these passages with a group of experts. Each expert presents different perspectives based on the foundational and advanced knowledge from the passages. Identify points of agreement and disagreement among the experts, and analyze how these differing perspectives contribute to a deeper understanding of the topic. Synthesize the insights from the discussion into a cohesive summary that captures the full range of foundational and advanced knowledge. Highlight how these perspectives expand the understanding of the question.

By participating in this collaborative discussion, you will deepen the model's understanding through the synthesis of multiple expert perspectives.

**Expert 1: Film Historian**
"I'd like to start by emphasizing that Johnny Depp's portrayal of Ichabod Crane in Tim Burton's 1999 film 'Sleepy Hollow' is a fascinating reinterpretation of the character. Depp's Crane is not just a typical action hero; he embodies a quirky, fragile persona that contrasts sharply with the traditional image of a policeman. This choice adds depth to the character and aligns with Burton's unique style. The film itself is a blend of horror and dark humor, which is evident in Depp's performance."

**Expert 2: Literary Scholar**
"From a literary perspective, it's important to note that Depp's portrayal diverges from Washington Irving's original depiction of Ichabod Crane. While the film retains some elements of the source material, such as Crane's role as a schoolteacher and his interactions with the supernatural, Depp's character is more psychologically complex. The backstory provided in the film—his traumatic childhood—adds layers to his character that Irving did not explore. This adaptation reflects a modern sensibility that seeks to understand characters' motivations more deeply."

**Expert 3: Cultural Critic**
"I agree with both of you, but I'd like to highlight how Depp's interpretation of Ichabod Crane reflects contemporary cultural themes. His character's fear of blood and death can be seen as a commentary on modern anxieties surrounding violence and mortality. In a post-9/11 world, where fear and vulnerability are prevalent, Depp's Crane resonates with audiences who may feel similarly fragile in the face of societal chaos. This adds a layer of relevance to the film that goes beyond mere entertainment."

**Expert 4: Performance Analyst**
"Building on that point, Depp's performance is also notable for its physicality and mannerisms. He draws inspiration from various actors, including Angela Lansbury and Basil Rathbone, which informs his unique take on the character. His portrayal is not just about the dialogue; it's about how he embodies Ichabod's quirks and fears through his body language and expressions. This attention to detail enhances the character's relatability and makes him memorable."

**Expert 5: Tim Burton Aficionado**
"I think we should also consider how Burton's direction shapes Depp's performance. Burton has a distinct visual style that complements the film's themes of isolation and fear. The gothic aesthetic of 'Sleepy Hollow' amplifies Ichabod's internal struggles, making Depp's portrayal even more impactful. The collaboration between Burton and Depp has produced a character that is both visually and emotionally compelling."

**Synthesis of Insights:**
The discussion reveals a multifaceted understanding of Johnny Depp's portrayal of Ichabod Crane in 'Sleepy Hollow.' Experts agree that Depp's interpretation is a departure from traditional representations, emphasizing psychological complexity and vulnerability. While the film retains elements from Irving's original story, it also introduces modern themes of fear and fragility, resonating with contemporary audiences. Depp's performance, informed by various influences and enhanced by Burton's direction, creates a character that is both relatable and memorable.

In summary, the collaborative insights from the panel highlight how Depp's Ichabod Crane serves as a lens through which we can explore deeper cultural anxieties, the evolution of character portrayal in film adaptations, and the interplay between performance and direction. This discussion enriches our understanding of the film and its characters, illustrating the layers of meaning that can be derived from a single portrayal.

**Discussion-enhanced reasoning process:**
To answer the question about the film in which Johnny Depp plays a policeman named Ichabod Crane, I first identify the character's origins in Washington Irving's "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow." Depp's portrayal occurs in Tim Burton's 1999 film "Sleepy Hollow." The discussion among experts reveals several layers of interpretation regarding Depp's performance and the film's adaptation of the source material.

1. **Film Historian's Perspective:** Depp's portrayal is characterized as a reinterpretation that diverges from the traditional action hero archetype. This highlights the depth and complexity of his character, which aligns with Burton's unique style that blends horror and dark humor.

2. **Literary Scholar's Perspective:** The film adaptation introduces a more psychologically complex Ichabod Crane, exploring themes of trauma and vulnerability that are not present in Irving's original work. This modern sensibility allows for a deeper understanding of character motivations.

3. **Cultural Critic's Perspective:** Depp's character reflects contemporary anxieties about violence and mortality, making him relatable to modern audiences. This relevance adds a layer of significance to the film beyond its entertainment value.

4. **Performance Analyst's Perspective:** The physicality and mannerisms of Depp's performance are crucial to understanding Ichabod's quirks and fears. His approach, influenced by various actors, enhances the character's relatability and memorability.

By synthesizing these insights, it becomes clear that Depp's portrayal of Ichabod Crane is not only a significant adaptation of a literary character but also a reflection of broader cultural themes and modern anxieties. The film's gothic aesthetic and psychological depth contribute to a richer understanding of the character and the narrative.

**Answer:**
Johnny Depp played the character Ichabod Crane in the film "Sleepy Hollow," directed by Tim Burton in 1999.

Christina Ricci, who worked with producer Scott Rudin on "The Addams Family", was cast as Katrina Van Tassel. "Sleepy Hollow" also reunited Burton with Jeffrey Jones (from "Beetlejuice" and "Ed Wood") as Reverend Steenwyck, Christopher Walken (Max Shreck in "Batman Returns") as the Hessian Horseman, Martin Landau ("Ed Wood") in a cameo role, and Hammer veteran Michael Gough (Alfred in Burton\'s "Batman" films), whom Burton tempted out of retirement. The Hammer influence was further confirmed by the casting of Christopher Lee in a small role as the Burgomaster who sends Crane to Sleepy Hollow.\n', 'BULLET::::- Constable Ichabod Crane serves as the protagonist in the 1999 film adaptation of "Sleepy Hollow", directed by Tim Burton and starring Johnny Depp. In this interpretation, he is a New York City policeman with an interest in Forensic science sent to Sleepy Hollow to investigate a series of grisly murders to prove the merits of his style of the investigation after he argues against the police\'s current methods. As in the original story, his horse is named Gunpowder. Ichabod\'s most notable traits in the movie include an ahead-of-his-time liking for post-mortem examinations, deduction, and scientific methods, as well as his being very quirky, skittish, and being disturbed by death and blood, despite his occupation. His backstory is also explored: when he was seven his mother, an "innocent child of Nature" was "murdered to save her soul" by his father, "a Bible black tyrant behind a mask of righteousness" which led to a loss of faith for him. It is Ichabod who finally releases the Hessian Headless Horseman (Christopher Walken) from the control of Lady van Tassel (Miranda Richardson), whom the Horseman takes to Hell with him. Katrina Van Tassel (Christina Ricci) is seen at the end of the movie going back to New York with Ichabod, along with a boy who helped him in the investigation. Brom Bones (Casper Van Dien), who at one point does disguise himself as the Horseman and throws a pumpkin at Ichabod, is killed by the real Horseman halfway in the film.\n', 'Depp\'s next venture with Burton was the period film "Sleepy Hollow" (1999), in which he played Ichabod Crane opposite Christina Ricci and Christopher Walken. For his performance, Depp took inspiration from Angela Lansbury, Roddy McDowall and Basil Rathbone. He stated that he "always thought of Ichabod as a very delicate, fragile person who was maybe a little too in touch with his feminine side, like a frightened little girl."\n', 'BULLET::::- Ichabod Crane is also featured in the 2013 episodic video game, "The Wolf Among Us", developed and produced by Telltale Games. In the game, Crane (voiced by Roger L. Jackson) is the deputy mayor of Fabletown, a secret community of magical, fairytale beings who were exiled from their Homelands centuries ago and forced to live in the world of mundane humans. In episodes 2 through three, Crane was revealed to have been soliciting prostitutes and using a magic spell to make them look like his assistant Snow White; Sheriff Bigby Wolf and Snow arrest Crane for this and embezzling Fabletown\'s money to pay for them, but Crane is then kidnapped by the minions of the Crooked Man, the crime lord Crane owes money to.\n']

Task Description:

consolidate these contents, and analyze how the selected information may impact the improvement of the model's causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities.

To enhance the model's causal reasoning and logical inference abilities, we can extract and consolidate key information from the provided passages regarding Johnny Depp's role as Ichabod Crane in the film "Sleepy Hollow." Here’s a breakdown of the relevant content:

### Extracted Content:
1. **Character Description**: 
   - Ichabod Crane is portrayed as a quirky and sympathetic constable who integrates modern science into police procedures but is squeamish about blood and bugs.
   - He is characterized as delicate, fragile, and somewhat in touch with his feminine side, which deviates from traditional action hero portrayals.

2. **Film Context**:
   - The film "Sleepy Hollow," directed by Tim Burton, was released in 1999 and features Depp as the protagonist investigating a series of grisly murders.
   - Ichabod Crane's backstory includes a traumatic childhood event that shapes his character and worldview, specifically the murder of his mother by his father.

3. **Character's Role and Actions**:
   - Ichabod is sent to Sleepy Hollow to prove the merits of his investigative methods, which emphasizes his role as a detective.
   - He employs forensic science and deduction, showcasing a progressive approach to crime-solving for his time.

4. **Character Relationships**:
   - The film includes significant interactions with other characters, such as Katrina Van Tassel and the Hessian Horseman, which influence Ichabod's journey and decisions.

5. **Influences on Performance**:
   - Depp drew inspiration from various actors and performances, indicating a thoughtful approach to character development that reflects on past portrayals.

### Analysis of Impact on Causal Reasoning and Logical Inference:
1. **Character Complexity**: Understanding Ichabod Crane's multifaceted personality allows the model to recognize how background and personal history can influence behavior and decision-making. This can enhance the model's ability to infer motivations behind actions in various contexts.

2. **Integration of Science and Tradition**: The contrast between Ichabod's modern investigative techniques and the traditional methods of his time can help the model analyze conflicts between innovation and established norms, improving its reasoning about societal changes and their implications.

3. **Character Relationships**: The dynamics between Ichabod and other characters can inform the model about the importance of relationships in shaping outcomes. This can enhance the model's ability to infer how interactions affect character development and plot progression.

4. **Narrative Structure**: The film's narrative, which includes a protagonist overcoming personal trauma while solving a mystery, can help the model understand the structure of storytelling and the causal relationships between events, character growth, and thematic elements.

5. **Performance Influences**: Recognizing the influences on Depp's portrayal of Ichabod can enhance the model's understanding of how historical and cultural contexts shape character interpretations, which can be applied to analyze other performances and their implications.

By consolidating these insights, the model can improve its ability to make logical inferences about character motivations, societal dynamics, and narrative structures, ultimately enhancing its causal reasoning capabilities in various contexts.

In which film did Johnny Depp play a policeman called Ichabod Crane?
answer:

To answer the question, I need to identify the film in which Johnny Depp portrays a character named Ichabod Crane. Ichabod Crane is a well-known character from Washington Irving's "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow." Johnny Depp played this character in the film adaptation directed by Tim Burton. The film is known for its dark and gothic style, which is characteristic of Burton's work. 

Answer: Sleepy Hollow

In which film did Johnny Depp play a policeman called Ichabod Crane?

['BULLET::::- Johnny Depp as Ichabod Crane: Crane is a quirky, yet sympathetic constable infatuated with integrating modern science into police procedures, but is squeamish at the sight of blood and bugs. Depp is humorous in his portrayal of the character.\n', 'While Johnny Depp was Burton\'s first choice for the role of Ichabod Crane, Paramount required him to consider Brad Pitt, Liam Neeson and Daniel Day-Lewis. Depp was cast in July 1998 for his third collaboration with Burton. The actor wanted Ichabod to parallel Irving\'s description of the character in the short story. This included a long prosthetic snipe nose, huge ears, and elongated fingers. Paramount turned down his suggestions, and after Depp read Tom Stoppard\'s rewrite of the script, he was inspired to take the character even further. "I always thought of Ichabod as a very delicate, fragile person who was maybe a little too in touch with his feminine side, like a frightened little girl," Depp explained. He did not wish to portray the character as a typical action star would have, and instead took inspiration by Angela Lansbury\'s performance in "Death on the Nile". "It\'s good," Burton reasoned, "because I\'m not the greatest action director in the world, and he\'s not the greatest action star." Depp modeled Ichabod\'s detective personality from Basil Rathbone in the 1939 "Sherlock Holmes" film series. He also studied Roddy McDowall\'s acting for additional influence. Burton added that "the idea was to try to find an elegance in action of the kind that Christopher Lee or Peter Cushing or Vincent Price had." Christina Ricci, who worked with producer Scott Rudin on "The Addams Family", was cast as Katrina Van Tassel. His backstory is also explored: when he was seven his mother, an "innocent child of Nature" was "murdered to save her soul" by his father, "a Bible black tyrant behind a mask of righteousness" which led to a loss of faith for him. It is Ichabod who finally releases the Hessian Headless Horseman (Christopher Walken) from the control of Lady van Tassel (Miranda Richardson), whom the Horseman takes to Hell with him. Katrina Van Tassel (Christina Ricci) is seen at the end of the movie going back to New York with Ichabod, along with a boy who helped him in the investigation. For his performance, Depp took inspiration from Angela Lansbury, Roddy McDowall and Basil Rathbone. Jackson) is the deputy mayor of Fabletown, a secret community of magical, fairytale beings who were exiled from their Homelands centuries ago and forced to live in the world of mundane humans. question_info.question: In which film did Johnny Depp play a policeman called Ichabod Crane?
passages:
BULLET::::- Johnny Depp as Ichabod Crane: Crane is a quirky, yet sympathetic constable infatuated with integrating modern science into police procedures, but is squeamish at the sight of blood and bugs. Depp is humorous in his portrayal of the character.
While Johnny Depp was Burton's first choice for the role of Ichabod Crane, Paramount required him to consider Brad Pitt, Liam Neeson and Daniel Day-Lewis. Depp was cast in July 1998 for his third collaboration with Burton. The actor wanted Ichabod to parallel Irving's description of the character in the short story. This included a long prosthetic snipe nose, huge ears, and elongated fingers. Paramount turned down his suggestions, and after Depp read Tom Stoppard's rewrite of the script, he was inspired to take the character even further. "I always thought of Ichabod as a very delicate, fragile person who was maybe a little too in touch with his feminine side, like a frightened little girl," Depp explained. He did not wish to portray the character as a typical action star would have, and instead took inspiration by Angela Lansbury's performance in "Death on the Nile". "It's good," Burton reasoned, "because I'm not the greatest action director in the world, and he's not the greatest action star." Depp modeled Ichabod's detective personality from Basil Rathbone in the 1939 "Sherlock Holmes" film series. He also studied Roddy McDowall's acting for additional influence. Burton added that "the idea was to try to find an elegance in action of the kind that Christopher Lee or Peter Cushing or Vincent Price had." Christina Ricci, who worked with producer Scott Rudin on "The Addams Family", was cast as Katrina Van Tassel. "Sleepy Hollow" also reunited Burton with Jeffrey Jones (from "Beetlejuice" and "Ed Wood") as Reverend Steenwyck, Christopher Walken (Max Shreck in "Batman Returns") as the Hessian Horseman, Martin Landau ("Ed Wood") in a cameo role, and Hammer veteran Michael Gough (Alfred in Burton's "Batman" films), whom Burton tempted out of retirement. The Hammer influence was further confirmed by the casting of Christopher Lee in a small role as the Burgomaster who sends Crane to Sleepy Hollow.
BULLET::::- Constable Ichabod Crane serves as the protagonist in the 1999 film adaptation of "Sleepy Hollow", directed by Tim Burton and starring Johnny Depp. In this interpretation, he is a New York City policeman with an interest in Forensic science sent to Sleepy Hollow to investigate a series of grisly murders to prove the merits of his style of the investigation after he argues against the police's current methods. As in the original story, his horse is named Gunpowder. Ichabod's most notable traits in the movie include an ahead-of-his-time liking for post-mortem examinations, deduction, and scientific methods, as well as his being very quirky, skittish, and being disturbed by death and blood, despite his occupation. His backstory is also explored: when he was seven his mother, an "innocent child of Nature" was "murdered to save her soul" by his father, "a Bible black tyrant behind a mask of righteousness" which led to a loss of faith for him. It is Ichabod who finally releases the Hessian Headless Horseman (Christopher Walken) from the control of Lady van Tassel (Miranda Richardson), whom the Horseman takes to Hell with him. Katrina Van Tassel (Christina Ricci) is seen at the end of the movie going back to New York with Ichabod, along with a boy who helped him in the investigation. Brom Bones (Casper Van Dien), who at one point does disguise himself as the Horseman and throws a pumpkin at Ichabod, is killed by the real Horseman halfway in the film.
Depp's next venture with Burton was the period film "Sleepy Hollow" (1999), in which he played Ichabod Crane opposite Christina Ricci and Christopher Walken. For his performance, Depp took inspiration from Angela Lansbury, Roddy McDowall and Basil Rathbone. He stated that he "always thought of Ichabod as a very delicate, fragile person who was maybe a little too in touch with his feminine side, like a frightened little girl."
BULLET::::- Ichabod Crane is also featured in the 2013 episodic video game, "The Wolf Among Us", developed and produced by Telltale Games. In the game, Crane (voiced by Roger L. Jackson) is the deputy mayor of Fabletown, a secret community of magical, fairytale beings who were exiled from their Homelands centuries ago and forced to live in the world of mundane humans. In episodes 2 through three, Crane was revealed to have been soliciting prostitutes and using a magic spell to make them look like his assistant Snow White; Sheriff Bigby Wolf and Snow arrest Crane for this and embezzling Fabletown's money to pay for them, but Crane is then kidnapped by the minions of the Crooked Man, the crime lord Crane owes money to.
